text: hi everyone clamptony down Tano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new Amaray
album Fountain baby sophomore record
here from ghanian American pop singer
and songwriter Amaray honestly went into
this new record over here completely
blind off of a random shade filled
comment or tweet I got somewhere on
social media saying something like so
we're just like not gonna review the new
Amaray album and I was like oh [ __ ]
what what is this energy I'm gonna try
this album out and if it's mid I'm gonna
be so pissed but no uh it was actually
it was actually fire so Amaray began to
gain attention uh during the first year
of the pandemic off a hot track that
eventually gained so much traction it
eventually earned a remix featuring none
other than kaliuchi's which makes total
sense because I think Cali and Amber
array have a lot in common creatively
maybe not in a super literal sense in
that I think they sound exactly the same
I mean there is certainly a Common
Thread between them in that they both
have uh respectively light sweet dreamy
voices but beyond that I think a lot of
their common ground is shared in the
fact that they are super versatile pop
artists that borrow from a wide variety
of genres and care a lot about songcraft
and and and also take a pretty subtle
approach now making pop music that is
super soft super ethereal it can be kind
of a risk going too easy can often lead
to things sounding maybe too forgettable
or Bland and to be fair there are a few
moments on this record that do kind of
meander with Amores vocals aimlessly
exploring these uh very spacious beds of
guitars and beats but for the most part
these tracks actually have a high amount
of impact despite their also high level
of Elegance and chill almost like that
of an early FKA twigs album but wait
wait wait wait way warmer in terms of
vibe and I would say more danceable too
the versatility of this record is also
Apparent from the jump with angels which
is like hot soup on a stove top with
elements of African music Asian music
and high art pop music all boiling
together aggressively to the point where
it's hard to tell what's what or if the
song has any super defined origin to it
I would say that's also the case for the
song Wasted eyes also deeper into the
record we get tracks that fuse together
elements of again Pop R B dance hall
afrobeats hip-hop and electronic music
too the track co-star features all of
these elegant harp arpeggios set to
bustling beats that are topped with a
lot of funny and flirty lyrics about
astrology and star signs instrumentally
and vocally the whole thing sounds like
a silky sex dream we have more themes of
desire and Temptation turning up on the
track princess going digital too with
some hot ass grooves drum fills and call
and response vocals it's giving fantasy
dance party in this city in the middle
of the night meanwhile with big steppa I
don't typically like my dance hall this
dreamy but the touches of strings and
background vocals and horns on this
track are actually Stellar multiple Cuts
above anything I've heard in the
mainstream that has tried to take a
lighter approach with the style of music
I could say much the same for the track
Reckless and sweet which also puts a
very pillowy veneer over a lot of West
African music elements Amores vocals on
this track also sound especially
mesmerizing and intimate then one of the
most amazing crazy and surprising
moments on the record comes in the form
of counterfeit we have another bold
Banger on here with a lot of crazy
cultural fusions that seem almost
m-i-a-esque and how they just like kind
of Jam these various Vibes and ideas
together but one of the most
recognizable sounds on it is the steel
drum lines from that Pharrell bead off
the eclipse album Hell hath no fury for
wampwamp as a huge Clips fan it's kind
of hard to not think of that track while
listening uh to this but still Amaray
does make it her own and I love on this
record she can drop a track that hot
that steamy that in your face but then
also match it with the song disguise
which is maybe the most Whimsical and
Theatrical cut on the bunch especially
with the male female vocal harmonies the
chilly atmosphere surrounding it all and
the refined touches of strings the final
leg of this record also keeps things
pretty interesting with sex violence and
suicide the first portion of this track
drags a little bit with Amaray not
really going anywhere fast vocally over
some very Spacey guitar arpeggios it's
kind of winding it's a little repetitive
but eventually in the final leg of the
song it bursts out into this uh punk
rock passage that honestly sounds more
raw and interesting than many artists in
the pop field just quickly kind of going
Punk for a minute or two on a random
song here and there the guitar
Distortion combined with Amore's vocals
being so high pitched and shouty it it
almost feels like otaboke Beaver
sociopathic dance Queen is not just an
excellent title for a song but yet
another dreamy pop Banger aquamarine
loves ecstasy I think could have used a
bit more variation across its run time
but still getting some big shot day
Vibes off of this track in the best way
water from wine all I can really say
about this one is it's pure ecstasy and
the closer come home to God is a big
final moment on this record and another
surprising switch up too because we get
some rock drums and some shoddy grouper
frames and some very eerie breathy lead
vocals on the verses too which all make
for an interesting contrast from these
lyrics about kind of you know going
crazy on the pole with over-the-top
lyrics like uh when I'm in that [ __ ]
I'm above the law there's a heavy and
Sinister finish on the track as well
with like some distorted bass and once
again really impressed with what Amory
brought to the table on this album The
diversity the texture the Tunes the
vocal performances the details this
thing is creative it's bold it's sweet
it's enchanting and honestly I think she
really knocked it out of the park on
this thing I'm feeling a strong a20
